titleInfo.title: Letter from the underwriters of the cargo of the British ship Centaur, to Charles Allen, Secretary to the Government of India

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing a narrative from Captain Salmon, describing the loss and plunder of the Centaur. The narrative states that the Centaurwas sailing from Calcutta to Bushire and Bassorah [Basra], and carrying rice, sugar, and 1645 chests of indigo. At the end of the narrative is a list of the insurers of the Centaur'scargo, and the items, with their value, that each insured.
